entry.title: More than $4 million awarded to 203 Oregon nonprofits
entry.summary: Oregon Community Foundation is awarding $4.7 million in community grants to 203 nonprofit organizations throughout Oregon, including four in Douglas County.

entry.title: Law enforcement continue search for Riddle homicide suspect Gauge Main
entry.summary: Detectives are renewing their request for information on the whereabouts of homicide suspect Gauge Douglas James Main.

entry.title: Sutherlin man arrested for assaulting officer
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — Sutherlin police jailed a man after he allegedly assaulted a public safety officer Sunday.

entry.title: Yo-yos inspire Sunnyslope students
entry.summary: GREEN — With bouncy music playing in the background, students filed into the gymnasium and watched with anticipation as a presenter, dressed in black and purple, began spinning a plastic yo-yo in front of them until they settled down.

entry.title: HOMICIDE SUSPECT AT LARGE, DETECTIVES RENEW REQUEST FOR INFORMATION
entry.summary: November 28, 2023 4:00 a.m. Detectives are renewing their request for information as to the whereabouts of a homicide suspect who allegedly killed a Grants Pass man last Monday. Lieutenant Brad O’Dell of the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office said 19-year old Gauge Douglas James Main of Riddle is wanted in connection to the homicide of...

entry.title: SATURDAY NIGHT CRASH CLAIMS LIFE OF SUTHERLIN WOMAN
entry.summary: November 28, 2023 3:45 a.m. A Sutherlin woman died in a single-vehicle crash on Saturday. Lieutenant Brad O’Dell of the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office said shortly before 11:00 p.m. dispatchers received a report of an injury crash in the 15000 block of Highway 99N near Oakland. O’Dell said upon arrival, deputies determined that the driver...

entry.title: AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY CONTINUES THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING
entry.summary: November 28, 2023 3:40 a.m. An Air Stagnation Advisory continues through 10:00 a.m. Thursday for much of the region. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said stagnant air is expected, which may lead to deteriorating air quality. This is especially in and near areas with significant sources of air pollution. Diminished air quality can cause...

entry.title: DENSE FOG ADVISORY THROUGH 10:00 A.M. TUESDAY
entry.summary: November 28, 2023 3:30 a.m. A Dense Fog Advisory is in effect until 10:00 a.m. Tuesday for central Douglas County. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said visibility of less than one quarter of a mile in dense fog is expected. Driving conditions are hazardous, due to low visibility. Temperatures around the freezing mark could...

entry.title: WILL LATHROP FILES TO BECOME OREGON’S NEXT ATTORNEY GENERAL
entry.summary: November 28, 2023 3:15 a,m. On Monday, human rights attorney Will Lathrop, filed for the office of Oregon Attorney General as a Republican. A release said Lathrop began campaigning at the start of the year, and has raised $300,000 so far, as he has campaigned in 25 of Oregon’s 36 counties. Lathrop has earned the...

entry.title: FESTIVAL OF TREES BEGINS THIS WEEK
entry.summary: November 28, 2023 3:00 a.m. Mercy Foundation’s Festival of Trees begins later this week. The four-day series of events will run from Thursday through Sunday at Seven Feathers Convention Center in Canyonville. It is the 30th anniversary for the festival which offers many opportunities to support the organization’s fundraising efforts. Festival of Trees is presented...

entry.title: FEEDING UMPQUA SEEKING SUPPORT ON GIVING TUESDAY
entry.summary: November 28, 2023 2:50 a.m. For this year’s Giving Tuesday on November 28th, the global giving day, Feeding Umpqua, a program of United Community Action Network, is asking Douglas County residents to help meet the holiday need by getting involved. Feeding Umpqua Director Sarah McGregor said many organizations around the area are hosting holiday food...

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 11.27.23
entry.summary: Peace at Home Advocacy Center Executive Director Melanie Prummer talks about the issue of youth homeless and what is being done later to help the situation. Click here to download for later listening: IDC 11 27 2023

The incident reportedly occurred at a home in the 2700 block of Northwest Kline Street. She...

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 11.27.23
entry.summary: Joining us from Washington D.C., 2nd District Congressman Cliff Bentz talks about the White House Council on Environmental Quality and his concerns about recently negotiated mediation concerning the Columbia River System Operations. He also discussed the dam situation on the Klamath River and related topics. Click here download for later listening: 830 11 27 23

entry.title: Food Bank official: Hunger increases in US, Oregon

entry.title: COUNTY CELEBRATES 50TH ANNUAL CHRISTMAS CRAFT FAIR
entry.summary: November 27, 2023 3:30 a.m. Douglas County government is celebrating the 50th anniversary of the Christmas Craft Fair this Friday through Sunday. entry.title: FARA HOPING TO RAISE $50,000 IN 50 DAYS
entry.summary: November 27, 2023 3:20 a.m. Family Faith and Relationship Advocates is celebrating its 5th anniversary and is hoping to raise $50,000 in 50 days to continue creating safe environments for children to thrive. FARA will hold a 12 Days of Christmas event starting December 10th. It will feature a live-online auction. For more information call...

entry.title: ARTISAN GALLEY IN WINCHESTER BAY OPEN SEVEN DAYS A WEEK

entry.title: Local campground wins awards from Kampgrounds of America
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — Kampgrounds of America, the world’s largest system of publicly open campgrounds, announced the Sutherlin/Umpqua Valley Kampgrounds of America Holiday campground earned the Kampgrounds of America Founder’s and President’s awards. entry.title: Favorite reads of the year
entry.summary: As 2023 wraps up, I am reflecting on my favorite books of the year. Great plots, fully realized characters, amazing writing … I had another banner year of reading.

entry.title: FREEZE WARNING/FROST ADVISORY FOR SOUTH CENTRAL OREGON COAST
